title: (x) Dodgers - custom designed {Mark S}
content: I don't think it's a font, but there are some fonts like this. Kestrel would be similar, but I don't think it's available in digital format. You might also try Leslie Cabarga's [Casey](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142509/http:/www.flashfonts.com/flashsite/fontspage.htm).
author: Mark Simonson

comments.content:
Another one I suggest to people who want the baseball style swashes is [Letterhead Fonts "Pilsner"](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142509/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/tomkennedy/pilsner.shtml), which comes with a whole font set of swash shapes you can add to the names. (Looks like Casey might have some too. That was a new one for me Mark.)   
   
Letterhead also has one called [Ephemera](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142509/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/tomkennedy/ephemera.shtml), with swashes, but the letter style is much older and fancier-looking.

I recently purchased Pilsner for use in a magazine layout. The story was about minor league baseball, and the font and swashes worked well. They required minor manual tweaking, but got me very close to the old-school baseball logo look very quickly.
